verbs.description: some l a streets [V: are] n't being repaved because of a law dating from the depression hundreds of streets were officially withdrawn from public use in los angeles during the great depression when the city said it did n’t have enough money to fix dangerous streets decades later some have still not been reinstated san miguel el salvador blumenfield woodland hills law niagara falls depression bobbie wasserman
